decks.notes: The key concept of this Modern Control-Faeries deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing counterspells, targeted removal, and disruptive creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Spellstutter Sprite, while efficiently removing threats with Bitterblossom, Fatal Push, and Hero's Downfall. Cryptic Command provides versatile options for controlling the game, while Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor offer additional card advantage and disruption. The deck's land base supports its strategy by providing color options, card filtering, and manlands for added threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Hardened Scales enchantment to maximize the +1/+1 counters placed on creatures. By distributing counters using creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Hangarback Walker, along with the support of Steel Overseer and Metallic Mimic, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flood of powerful creatures. The inclusion of cards like Animation Module and Walking Ballista provide additional ways to generate +1/+1 counters and control the board. The deck's strategy revolves around quickly building up a threatening board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to lower the cost of Death's Shadow, a powerful creature that becomes larger as your life total decreases. By using aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Wild Nacatl, along with efficient spells like Temur Battle Rage and Become Immense, the deck aims to enable a fast and deadly assault on the opponent. Thoughtseize helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while Mishra's Bauble provides card selection. The deck is designed to be proactive, applying pressure and forcing the opponent to react quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Shriekhorn in order to trigger powerful graveyard recursion effects from cards like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. By dredging through your deck and utilizing graveyard abilities, you can rapidly assemble a board presence and overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures. The combo potential of this deck lies in its ability to consistently and aggressively exploit the graveyard as a valuable resource to fuel your game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly casting low-cost spells to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability and bring it back from the graveyard. It also utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to fill up the graveyard with spells. Additionally, Thing in the Ice is used as a potential finisher once it transforms, while Crackling Drake provides card advantage and a solid flying threat. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of burn spells, efficient creatures, and recursive threats.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. By utilizing efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with direct damage spells like Lava Spike and Lightning Bolt, it aims to apply constant pressure early on. The deck also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze to control the board and punish opponents for playing spells. With a strong mana base and versatile spells like Boros Charm and Atarka's Command, this deck aims to win games quickly through overwhelming aggression.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher, Thought-Knot Seer, and Endbringer to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail to control the opponent's game plan. The mana base is built around Urza's lands and Eldrazi Temple to consistently cast big Eldrazi threats early in the game. Overall, the deck aims to close out the game quickly with efficient creatures and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the combo of Jeskai Ascendancy along with mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Sylvan Caryatid to generate mana and draw cards while untapping your creatures. The deck also includes cantrips and dig spells to find the combo pieces quickly, along with Glittering Wish to fetch answers from the sideboard. The goal is to create a loop where you can generate enough mana and card advantage to eventually win the game with a massive storm count or through combat damage with a pumped up creature.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana and card advantage through the use of artifacts. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Terrarion, Mind Stone, and Ichor Wellspring to draw cards and generate mana. It also includes cards like Scrap Trawler and Krark-Clan Ironworks to create a powerful combo that allows for sacrificing artifacts and generating even more mana and card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Sai, Master Thopterist and Engineered Explosives to control the board and deal with opposing threats.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch to create an infinite loop of creature tokens with haste, allowing for a fast win condition. The deck also includes control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes versatile threats like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique, along with planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, to provide additional value and options in different matchups.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while assembling the combo pieces needed to win the game. It utilizes cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Chalice of the Void to limit the opponent's options, while cards like Whir of Invention and Ancient Stirrings help find key pieces of the combo. The deck also includes graveyard hate with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Witchbane Orb to protect against specific strategies. The goal is to control the game until the right pieces are in place to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using Spirit tribal synergies. By using cards like Collected Company and Aether Vial to cheat creatures onto the battlefield, alongside powerful Spirit creatures like Supreme Phantom, Spell Queller, and Drogskol Captain, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Additionally, cards like Mausoleum Wanderer and Selfless Spirit provide protection for the key creatures in the deck, allowing for a strong and efficient offense.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of aggressive Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to grow and buff the creatures, along with Aether Vial for instant speed creature deployment and disruption, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence. Cards like Meddling Mage, Kitesail Freebooter, and Reflector Mage provide additional disruption and control elements, while Mantis Rider and Tajic, Legion's Edge offer evasive threats. The mana base is optimized for casting Humans efficiently.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while also efficiently removing threats with Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy. The deck aims to apply early pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, backed up by powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope. Additionally, the deck has graveyard hate with Nihil Spellbomb and creature recursion with cards like Scavenging Ooze. The inclusion of Field of Ruin helps deal with problematic lands, adding another layer of disruption to the deck.

The deck focuses on using cards like Violent Outburst and Demonic Dread to cascade into Living End, which can bring back a large number of powerful creatures from the graveyard all at once. By cycling cards like Street Wraith and using abilities like Faerie Macabre's, the deck can quickly fill the graveyard with creatures to be brought back. Additionally, cards like Archfiend of Ifnir and Fulminator Mage provide additional value when they are brought back with Living End's effect. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large board presence and disruptive creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a powerful board presence through efficiently utilizing +1/+1 counters on creatures. By using cards like Hardened Scales and Arcbound Ravager, along with cards that generate additional creatures like Hangarback Walker and Walking Ballista, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a wide array of threatening creatures. The deck also includes cards like Animation Module and Throne of Geth to further enhance the +1/+1 counter synergy. Additionally, the deck includes tools like Mox Opal for mana acceleration and protection in the form of Welding Jar.
